f9be2571f26f.title: This whole “must be on a championship team” or even on a contender is crap if you’re talking about…

paragraphs.text: This whole “must be on a championship team” or even on a contender is crap if you’re talking about a most valuable PLAYER! If you had a player like Westbrook, or Curry or James playing as hard and as great as they do but they are on a TEAM that is having a crappy season, how does that make them less valuable? Their team’s overall performance shouldn…
paragraphs.name: c733

e62be68e7260.title: It feels like Russ is the only one of the four with anything left in his tank as the season winds…

paragraphs.text: It feels like Russ is the only one of the four with anything left in his tank as the season winds down. Maybe the other three are saving it for a playoff run or maybe that’s a microcosm of how Russ takes over every crunch time when he’s the only one at 100% at the end of games too.
paragraphs.name: ff5c

d3495d06ac44.title: The best thing about this year’s MVP debate is how it exposes all the bball idjits.

paragraphs.text: The best thing about this year’s MVP debate is how it exposes all the bball idjits. People act like this is somehow close or debatable, but Westbrook is handily playing the greatest bball right now. Only dinks like Simmons would rather boast about a more efficient usage metric with a marginally superior team win percentage. I thought he was some…

284a14906d66.title: It’s clearly Harden in my opinion.

paragraphs.text: It’s clearly Harden in my opinion. I don’t say this to disparage Westbrook, but he’s like the guy dangling shiny keys in your face when the guy next to him is juggling bowling balls. A bit of an extreme comparison, sure, but the gist is correct.
paragraphs.name: 6d16

virtuals.subtitle: (hoping that it’s all just real, pure athleticism, fingers crossed)

fe3bd9462f96.title: Bill and House make the argument that a triple double is arbitrary, but then argue that a player…

paragraphs.text: Bill and House make the argument that a triple double is arbitrary, but then argue that a player should have to win 50 games to win MVP. Both are arbitrary numbers. And while they make the argument that a few rebounds and assists shouldn't matter, why not 2–3 wins? Further, Westbrook isn't just averaging a triple double of 20, 10, and 10, he is…

paragraphs.text: Basketball is about numbers. Double doubles. Triple doubles. 20/10 games. 50 win seasons. 60 win seasons. A 73 win season. What’s the gold standard for going from a good year to a great year, 30 points a game, a 20/10 year, or remember the noise Kevin Love was making with 20/20 games?

virtuals.subtitle: Plus, y’know, the whole Durant thing. (Apropos of nothing — I would like to see KD’s reaction to finding out he is a Pokemon.)

paragraphs.text: Blame the Warriors. If Harden or Leonard had taken a game off them last week, the script would be different. Leonard would be the superstar leading the Spurs to a 1 seed over the superteam. Harden would be the one-man team who can win against the best, not just the rest.

6a99d27711c2.title: Last time I checked, nobody after Oscar Robertson came closer to averaging a triple-double on a…

paragraphs.text: Last time I checked, nobody after Oscar Robertson came closer to averaging a triple-double on a season than Harden. That is, if you leave away Westbrook, who will actually do it. Add to that the fact that the Rockets are much more competitive and the fact that Harden got snubbed at least a bit last year, when he didn’t win the MVP-trophy because…

280cf8e1c882.title: BS: in your rundown in the opening paragraph you list out a number of MVP contenders…….but

paragraphs.text:
BS: in your rundown in the opening paragraph you list out a number of MVP contenders…….but one name is missing: Giannis Antetokounmpo. Clearly #1 and #2 is between Westbrook and Harden (I’d vote Harden by the way)….but down around #3 or #4 needs to be Giannis!
Don’t forget about the Greek Freak!
paragraphs.name: 61b3

virtuals.subtitle: None of that takes away harden an amazing player but Westbrook just having a better one!

paragraphs.text: Seriously don’t understand why team record matters for individual awards Westbrook is having the best season. The best team already gets rewarded. If u want it to be the best player it’s lebron but u might as well do that award at the start of the season.
